instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
hi,
U5000 was covered in smc flux and it looked really bad. So, I replaced smc. Now, with dc cable on, it has 0.30A & nothing happens. With its battery on, no change, it doesn't turn on, fan turns, greenlight , battery not charging

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
Did you get SMC from donor board, same model?
Can you post some voltages and signals from power on sequence?

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
same model bought new from aliexpress
Can you tell me which signals should I check?

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
NEW, isn't from donor board???

Disconnect battery, use only original Magsafe 2 charger.
Do you get voltage at L7310/20?
If yes, check PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
no new smc ,
L7310/20 =no voltage

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message: Which coils get voltage now?

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
L7630 = 1 Voltage
L7439 = 1.2 Voltage
L7560 = 3.3 Voltage
L7520 = 5 Voltage
L7130= 8.20 Voltage
L3095 = No Voltage
L7701 = No Voltage

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
Post U1950 voltages.

8.2V at F7140?

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
pin5 = 0.028 Voltage
pin6 =3.4 Voltage
pin7 =0.028 Voltage
pin8=3.4 Voltage
pin4 =GND
pin3=0.028 Voltage
pin2= 3.3 Voltage
pin1= 0.131 voltage


F7140 = 8,20 voltage

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
So missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
Remove Q8150 and test it again.

There is a problem with PPBUS_G3H also.

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
I removed the Q8150

pin5 = 0.028 Voltage
pin6 =3.4 Voltage
pin7 =0.028 Voltage
pin8=3.4 Voltage
pin4 =GND
pin3=0.028 Voltage
pin2= 3.3 Voltage
pin1= 0.131 voltage

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
What are these pins?
I said to remove Q8150 and check ALL_SYS_PWRGD again...

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
1st pin of u1950


pin5 = 0.028 Voltage
pin6 =3.4 Voltage
pin7 =0.028 Voltage
pin8=3.4 Voltage
pin4 =GND
pin3=0.028 Voltage
pin2= 3.3 Voltage
[FONT=arial][B]pin1= 0.131 voltage    =   ALL_SYS_PWRGD [/B][/FONT]

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
Why do you need to post all these, even repost, if I asked about one signal???
I saw the value in previous post, just wanted to make you avoid wasting time in the future...

Start removing each power good resistor from ALL_SYS_PWRGD, one by one; R8164/65/66/68.
Be sure R8167 is good; does it have 3V at pin 1?

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
before i checked what you wrote i noticed u8080 is too hot
I checked the c8080 and c8081 in diode mode, it gives = 0.008 
I removed the c8080  and c8081 and then checked it again no problem but c8080 and c8081 pin 1 diode mode, it gives = 0.008 
should i replace the u8080 ?

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
before i checked what you wrote i noticed u8080 is too hot
I checked the c8080 and c8081 in diode mode, it gives = 0.008
I removed the c8080  and c8081 and then checked it again no problem but c8080 and c8081 pin 1 diode mode, it gives = 0.008
so i changed U8080 and  ALL_SYS_PWRGD gives  3,3 voltage :) ( Q8150 I put it back) but same not turn on  it has 0.30A & nothing happens

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message: Now post U1950 voltages.

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
pin5 = 3.4 Voltage
pin6 =3.4 Voltage
pin7 = 3.4 Voltage
pin8= 3.4 Voltage
pin4 =GND
pin3= 3.3 Voltage
pin2= 3.3 Voltage
[B]pin1= 3.3 voltage = ALL_SYS_PWRGD[/B]

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
Looks good.
PLT_RESET_L comes high?

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message: PLT_RESET_L = no voltage

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message: Check CPU_VR_READY and CPU_VCCST_PWRGD.

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
device turns off when i CPU_VR_READY touch it

CPU_VCCST_PWRGD= 1.0 voltage

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message: Do you get 3V at both PM_PCH_PWROK and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK?

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
PM_PCH_PWROK = 3.4 voltage  (R1963 pin2)
 PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK  =3.4 voltage (R1962 pin2)

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
Looks like PCH issue.
Heat it with quality flux, in case of accumulated crap issue.

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message: Is the u9600 not faulty?

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message: i heated it on bga still the same

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
Clean/remove J6100.
Also check all resistors from LPC bus.

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message: meanwhile the battery is not charging Could it be related to smc? I said before that I changed

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
If you replaced with SMC from donor (good) board, it should charge the battery.
If not, there is other problem.

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:

no new smc ,

[/QUOTE]


I said that I installed a new smc on this device. But you didn't tell me it wouldn't work :)

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:
I don't understand.
Did you solder really new SMC (not good), or from donor board???

threads.title: 820-00165-A
threads.message:

I have already given the device back to the customer, but from now on, I will not buy any new devices.
thanks
